content:
• Thursday, April 26, 2012
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) -5% AH after beating FQ2 estimates but guiding for FY12 EPS of...

    Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) -5% AH after beating FQ2 estimates but guiding for FY12 EPS of $1.81-$1.84, below a consensus of $1.86. During its earnings call, Starbucks said it's increasing its target for new Asian stores on the year to 400 from 300, with half of the openings in China. 1,000 new stores are expected overall. GMCR -1.9%, though Starbucks promised to bring single-serve coffee to China and saw K-Cups contributing $0.03-$0.05 to FY12 EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:58 PM

  • AMZN

    Amazon states on its Q1 (I, II) earnings call (webcast) that sales from third parties on...

    Amazon states on its Q1 (I, II) earnings call (webcast) that sales from third parties on Amazon's site, which tend to carry lower margins, rose 300 bps Q/Q. The company also says it plans to invest another $800M-$900M on capex in Q2, evidence its aggressive spending isn't letting up. However, few details are provided about the Kindle and e-book disputes. AMZN +13.4% AH.

  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) is now up 4.8% AH following its Q1 report. The carrier boasts Q1 is is the...

    Clearwire (CLWR) is now up 4.8% AH following its Q1 report. The carrier boasts Q1 is is the first quarter in its history in which it produced net cash from operating activities, thanks to payments from Sprint. However, capex was just $23M - that will increase as Clearwire's LTE buildout occurs. Clearwire adds aggregate smartphone usage on its network rose 271%, evidence of the impact mobile data traffic is having on 3G and 4G networks. (PR)

  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) +11.2% AH after agreeing to acquire privately-held EUSA...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) +11.2% AH after agreeing to acquire privately-held EUSA Pharma for as much as $700M in cash. EUSA's FDA-approved Erwinaze treatment blocks cell growth in patients with acute leukemia by cutting down asparagine levels in the bloodstream. Jazz expects the deal to add $210M-$230M in revenue and $0.75-$0.85/share in earnings.

    UGG! Deckers (NASDAQ:DECK) -16.1% AH after the maker of UGG boots misses earnings...

    UGG! Deckers (NASDAQ:DECK) -16.1% AH after the maker of UGG boots misses earnings expectations and cuts full-year guidance. Earnings likely will decline 9%-10% this year, the company says, vs. prior guidance for flat earnings, "due primarily to an increase in cost of goods sold and a higher level of closeout sales."

    Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) guides on its FQ3 earnings call for FQ4 revenue of $4.2B-$4.4B and EPS of $2.35-$2.55. That's above a consensus of $4.19B and $2.30, but isn't enough to satisfy investors given today's massive beat and a 70%+ rally from WDC's November lows. WDC -8.1% AH. Falling in sympathy: STX -4.6%. QTM-OLD -2.1%. XRTX -2.4%.

  • EXPE

    More on Expedia's Q1: Strong results fueled by 24% Y/Y increase in room nights (37% for...

    More on Expedia's Q1: Strong results fueled by 24% Y/Y increase in room nights (37% for Hotels.com), up from 19% in Q4. Hotel revenue (70% of total) +17%, offsetting a 17% drop in plane ticket revenue (11% of total) due to lower prices. All other revenue sources (car rentals, ads, etc. ) +15%. $291M worth of shares repurchased. EXPE +16.5% AH. PCLN +0.8%. TZOO +1.7%. TRIP +2.2%. (PR - PDF)

    Allscripts (NASDAQ:MDRX) -45.8% AH after posting a bleak Q1 report and announcing a significant...

    Allscripts (NASDAQ:MDRX) -45.8% AH after posting a bleak Q1 report and announcing a significant management shakeup. Chairman Phil Pead has been kicked out, and 3 board members who disagreed are resigning. CFO Bill Davis is also stepping down. AllScripts' Q1 revenue of $365.5M and EPS of $0.12 missed by $22.2M and $0.12. The company now expects 2012 revenue of $1.48B-$1.52B and EPS of $0.74-$0.80, below a consensus of $1.64B and $1.09. QSII -6.3% in sympathy.  (PR)

    Interface (IFSIA +12%) surges after Raymond James raises its rating on the maker of floor...

    Interface (IFSIA +12%) surges after Raymond James raises its rating on the maker of floor coverings to Outperform from Market Perform a day after in-line Q1 results, noting Y/Y orders were better than sales for the first time in 18 months, a potential inflection point in demand. The CEO said business picked up in late February and momentum has continued to build in March.

With a current market cap of $5.3B, EA would be very tough for Nexon ($8B market cap) to swallow.
